item.description: Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0502; 09:38AM; 243 E 59th Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3UGuW93; #Florence; *Address Corrected* DETAILS: 39 Firefighters took just 19 minutes to access, confine and completely extinguish a fully involved 766 square-foot one story home at the rear of the property, preventing fire spread to nearby structures. One male civilian (unknown age / medical condition / site affiliation) was found outside the home with significant burn injury, and is being transported to an area hospital by LAFD Paramedics. No other injuries reported. The fire is considered suspicious, and the burned male will be interviewed by law enforcement (LAPD Newton Division Incident #1406) to determine his relationship if any, to the cause of the fire.; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E21 E221 E233 E264 E33 E46 EM13 RA246 RA264 RA846 SQ21 T21 T33 T64; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0502; 09:19AM; 157 E 59th Pl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xZcJtM; #Florence; *Address Tentative* - PRELIM: Heavy fire throughout an approximately 900 square-foot single family home to the rear of the property, with flames threatening a nearby home. ; FS 33; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 9; BC13 E21 E221 E233 E264 E33 E46 RA264 RA846 SQ21 T21 T33 T64 ; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Pedestrian Struck - Fatality; INC#1689; 10:14PM; 10601 S San Pedro St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3UB3gT7; #BroadwayManchester; PRELIM: One pedestrian deceased at scene after reportedly being struck by vehicle. No further details. Media Inquiries: LAPD South Traffic Division (Incident #4729) and Coroner.; FS 64; Batt 13; South Bureau; Council District 8; E264 RA33 T64; CH4; Brian Humphrey

Contained - Brush Fire; INC#0791; 02:21PM; 11770 W Foothill Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Lo2Fiz; #HansenDam; Despite an ambient temperature of 100.0 F during a NWS High Heat Warning, LAFD helicopters and ground crews, supported by two LACoFD Hand Crews, worked relentlessly for 82 minutes to stop forward progress of the fire, holding the blaze to two-and-one-half (2.50) acres of heavy brush within the Hansen Dam Recreation Area, east of the Aquatic Center. No injury. No structures. No evacuation. Ground crews will remain at scene this afternoon to complete containment, mop up hot spots and assure complete control. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC12 E24 E274 E275 E290 E75 E77 E8140 E89 E90 E91 E98 EM15 H1 H2 H3 H4 HA1 HA2 HA3 HA4 HT3 RA77 RA91 T74 T75 T90 WT77 + LACoFD Hand Crews; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Brush Fire; INC#0791; 12:59PM; 11770 W Foothill Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3Lo2Fiz; #HansenDam; PRELIM: LAFD ground and air response to a currently less than two (2) acre fire with a slow rate of spread in medium-to-heavy brush within the Hansen Dam Recreation Area (east of the Aquatic Center). No structure threat. No evacuation.; FS 98; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC10 BC12 E24 E274 E275 E75 E77 E90 E91 E98 EM15 H1 H2 H3 H4 HA1 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA77 RA91 T74 T75 WT77; CH5; 17; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#0735; 12:24PM; 3704 W 27th St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xQOi1q; #JeffersonPark; PRELIM: Traffic collision involving a concrete mixing truck, with one person (truck driver) briefly trapped, but now freed. Diesel fuel, motor oil and hydraulic fluid leak is now contained on site, though a small amount entered the storm drain system prior to LAFD arrival. No fire. Unknown circumstances. Media Inquiries: LAPD South Traffic Division (Incident #2207) and Stormwater Management.; FS 34; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 10; BC18 E215 E226 E229 E26 E34 EM9 HR3 RA14 RA15 RA26 T15 T26 T29; CH7; 14; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0678; 12:13PM; 109 N Sycamore Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3f7YKuS; #HancockPark; The first 38 arriving LAFD Firefighters took just 22 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish fire within one 4th floor unit of a 6 story, 25 unit center-hallway-style condominium building (5 occupied floors over parking). No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 61; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E203 E226 E227 E229 E261 E27 E35 E41 E61 E68 EM11 HR3 RA27 RA61 RA803 T26 T27 T29 T3 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0678; 11:51AM; 109 N Sycamore Av; MAP: https://bit.ly/3f7YKuS; #HancockPark; PRELM: 6 story center hallway style condominium (5 occupied floors over parking) with smoke showing from the 4th floor.; FS 61; Batt 18; South Bureau; Council District 5; BC1 BC11 BC18 BC5 CM20 CM22 E203 E226 E227 E229 E261 E27 E35 E41 E61 E68 EM11 HR3 RA27 RA61 T26 T27 T29 T3 T61 UR3 UR88; CH9; 13 14; Brian Humphrey

#LoboFire Brush Fire - Automatic Aid; INC#0767; 12:53PM; 24100 W Ventura Blvd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xQhYvP; Calabasas; Pursuant to an established Automatic Aid agreement, LAFD has responded by ground and air as an assisting agency to support the Los Angeles County Fire Department (LACoFD) in their management of the #LoboFire wildfire in the City of Calabasas. For official media and public info, follow @LACoFDPIO on Twitter (https://www.twitter.com/LACoFDPIO; FS Outside the City of Los Angeles; Currently Assigned LAFD Units: AO1 BC10 BC15 BC17 CM40 CM42 E104 E105 E273 E288 E290 E293 E296 E305 E447 E73 E83 E84 E89 E90 E93 EM17 H2 H3 H4 HA2 HA3 HA4 RA104 T105 T73 T88 T90 T93 T96; - Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0036; 01:40AM; 12250 W Ventura Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3dIDBY4; Studio City; FIRE NOW OUT: firefighters arrived to find an outside fire which extended into a 2 story commercial (in a row of commercials). Firefighters had smoke inside the structure and it took time as they investigated to find the fire which was located in the subfloor between the two floors. There was also residual smoke in the large attic which had to be throughly investigated to ensure there was no remaining fire. 40 firefighters achieved the knockdown in one hour and six mins with no injuries reported. The 9-1-1 call was received at 12:34 AM. No further details. ; FS 78; Batt 14; Valley Bureau; Council District 4; BC10 BC14 E102 E260 E27 E278 E289 E86 E97 EM14 RA78 T60 T78 T89; CH9; 17; Margaret Stewart
